I love the original Darklings better than part 2, got to admit because of the lovely main music, & beautiful intro it shows!

This version is better than the first version which was much more repetitive but I have 2 gripes. 1. Can the relay time get any slower? Finishing a game and exiting out or entering into a game or even the dialogue with the bosses take forever! There isn't even an option to skip the boss's speech even though it's the same speech ever level 2. Once you start unlocking new species, some of them are impossible to draw, not in terms of difficulty, but the in terms of getting the game to accept it as an answer. I've started skipping some of the places because there are symbols that no matter how quickly or in what manner I draw them, never seem to be acceptable. I wish there was a tutorial for how they want us to draw some of the symbols if that's the case
It's a fun game to play while in the subway or waiting. Gets pretty repetitive but I still enjoy playing.

This game is really cool

Cool!!!

I enjoyed season 1 when it first came out and was excited for this one. Unfortunately, season 2 is a complete step down from 1.  
For some reason, they decided to add dialogue, which, combined with the sometimes wonky English (they're from Turkey, I think), ruins the game's noir atmosphere they had going on. It's too silly for this game. 
They made the areas separate with a "capture the flag" process, as they put it. But after finishing 1 area, you have to spend crystals (their premium currency), to even unlock and play the next area. This whole app has been redone to try to get people to spend money. There's too many things in the shop locked behind ludicrous amounts of crystal. There's no way anyone could reasonably grind up that amount of crystal, so they expect us to pay for it.  
And somehow, their gesture recognition seems to be worse. If you're going to add more complex symbols, then make sure the recognition is up to par. Otherwise, it becomes much too frustrating in the new areas.  
Basically, they sacrificed the good things about this app to focus on monetization. I wish they could go back to making good games for gameplay, not making money.
Innovative and fun

So much so that it just isn't fun.

Back to the original.
I love the fast-paced gameplay, but it's very easy to die when the game lags

***The gesture recognition is dreadful*** I really enjoyed the first darklings game, and had been eagerly awaiting season two for a long, long time. Sadly, I'm extremely disappointed. This game is a huge step in the wrong direction. Seems like the devs spent all this time working on the appearance of the game, and the basics fell to the wayside. Many have mentioned the "pay to win" aspect, and they're right. Unlocking levels costs a gem, and levels lock every time you lose. So so sad, but I won't be playing this game anymore

The game looks like it'd be fun, but I honestly don't know.  The brief "tutorial" is vaguely worded and any attempts I've made to actually play the game with the one symbol it showed me has yielded no results at all.  There seems to be no help section anywhere in the game mechanics to try and learn how to actually play.  Unless you like spending your idle time doodling for 15 seconds before your Lum dies then waiting for energy to recharge so you can make another attempt do not pick this up if you are not already familiar with the game or its predecessor.

I loved the first Version of this game... Although I always felt there were areas that could use some improvement. I got the second version and I must admit, I am very disappointed. So far the game has been very glitchy. I draw a perfect symbol and the game glitches and half of my symbol doesn't show up and I get killed in the process. In addition, sometimes I could draw the perfect symbol 5xs in a row and it still kills me! This is even more frustrating when you make it all the way to a higher wave and then it doesn't register your symbol drawn and you get killed and then have to start all over at wave 1! Also, I feel like I am collecting more stars that it is registering... Which feels like an infinity in order to get enough to purchase something in the store. I would be more than happy to give it 5 stars if these issues were resolved.
